Hello, and welcome to the forums! 

Moving to "Science & Spacefilight", since this post has nothing to do with KSP.

Sounds like you're describing the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics (or something pretty close to it).  It's not really a "theory" because it's not provable or disprovable by observation (which is why it's referred to as an "interpretation" rather than a "theory").  But yes, it's an idea that's been around quite a while, and has been argued at great length by a lot of people.

Presentation by Sean Carroll on beginnings of the Unuverse that also contains short analysis on the nature of time, whether fundamental or emergent : http://www.preposterousuniverse.com/blog/2017/01/25/what-happened-at-the-big-bang/ (it's embedded the page, probably scroll down). 

It might be interesting to think that things could be a multiverse; but it's even more interesting that we probably just slices through the "universe" we currently lives in. Imagine if all things possible is the actual universe : your experiences is just one possible slice of the whole thing. It's not that the other choice doesn't happen, but causally you did what you could do and so there things goes instead in your experience.
